total_revenue.fx_impact: Strengthening US dollar resulted in a negative headwind to total revenue

Cloud_Services_and_License_Support.context: Cloud Services and License Support revenues accounted for 66% of total company revenue, up from 61% last year

Cloud_License_and_On-Premise_License.context: Cloud License and On-Premise License revenues were $2.0 billion, down 21% after being up 15% last Q4

Fusion_Apps.context: Includes Fusion ERP and Fusion HCM

drivers: Key customer wins such as Albertsons, CH Robinson Worldwide, DHL Supply Chain
Migration from legacy systems to Fusion ERP
Expansion of Fusion ERP suite with additional modules like EPM and Supply Chain Management
Adoption by large enterprises like McDonald's, Southwest Gas
Reduction in talent review process time by over 70%

NetSuite_ERP.context: NetSuite ERP revenue growth driven by a 25% increase

Vertical_SaaS.context: Vertical SaaS revenue growth in low-single digits
drivers: Enhanced feature sets tailored to vertical markets

Data_Cloud.context: Data Cloud revenue growth in low-single digits

Database_Revenue.context: Includes BYOL and Autonomous Database revenues, both up over 150%

drivers: Increased adoption of Bring Your Own License (BYOL) models
Expansion of BYOL offerings to more customers
Introduction and rapid adoption of Oracle Autonomous Database
High customer acquisition and trial rates
Expansion into regulated markets with Autonomous Database Cloud@Customer

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses details not explicitly provided in the transcript

COGS.context: Cost of Goods Sold details not explicitly provided in the transcript

operating_income.context: Non-GAAP operating income was $5.1 billion, down 2% YoY

eps.context: Non-GAAP Earnings Per Share was $1.20, up 5% in constant currency and 3% in USD; currency had a negative $0.02 impact on EPS

context: Assumes a base tax rate of 20%
One-time tax events may cause actual tax rates to vary
Expected to average around 20% for fiscal year 2020

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow over the last four quarters

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures over the last four quarters

free_cash_flow.context: Generated from operating activities after capital expenditures over the last four quarters

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures over the last four quarters

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased 107 million shares for a total of $5.2 billion this quarter; over the last 12 months, repurchased 361 million shares for $19.2 billion; over the last 10 years, reduced shares outstanding by nearly 40%

dividends.context: Declared a quarterly dividend of $0.24 per share

Fusion_and_Autonomous_Database.description: Growth and advancements in Fusion ERP, Fusion HCM, and the Autonomous Database
initiatives: Upgrading legacy systems to Fusion ERP and Fusion HCM
Expanding the Autonomous Database customer base
Enhancing security and reducing human error with autonomous technologies
Adopting Gen 2 Infrastructure including Autonomous Database for custom applications
goals: Become the largest back-office applications provider
Increase recurring revenue through cloud services
Prevent data theft and reduce operational costs with autonomous technologies
Simplify business model and processes to expand margins and grow EPS double-digits

revenue_growth.expectation: Minimal impact from COVID-19 on subscription revenue; wide range due to uncertainty
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to grow between 1% to 3% in total subscription revenues and -2% to +2% for total revenues
revenue_growth.fx_impact: Assuming a -1% currency headwind, total revenues are expected to grow between -1% to +1% in USD
factors: Growth in Oracle Cloud consumption and long-term contracts
Impact of COVID-19 on customer purchasing behavior

drivers: Investments in GitHub and Citus Data acquisitions
Continued investment in AI and commercial sales capacity

tax_rate.context: Consistent with Q1 and Q2 guidance
